Layout package¶

Layout.ChooseParametersWindow module¶

ChooseParameterRow(name, quantity, window)

This class contains the layout for a parameter row in the choose-parameters window.

ChooseParametersWindow(name, runner, quantities)

This class contains the layout for the choose-parameters window.

ChooseParametersWindowRunner(name, **kwargs)

This class runs ChooseParametersWindow. This window allows the user to… #. Choose which parameter(s) to overwrite into model.

This file contains classes relating to the choose-parameters window.

class Layout.ChooseParametersWindow.ChooseParameterRow(name, quantity, window)[source]

Bases: Layout.Layout.Row

This class contains the layout for a parameter row in the choose-parameters window.

  1. Label to indicate name of parameter.

  2. Label to indicate value and unit for parameter.

  3. Checkbox allow user to overwrite (or not) parameter into model.

Variables

quantity – quantity containing value and unit for parameter

getCheckbox()[source]

Get checkbox, allowing user to overwrite (or not) parameter value in model.

Parameters

self¶ – ChooseParameterRow to retrieve checkbox from

Return type

Checkbox

self¶ – ChooseParameterRow to retrieve label from

Return type

Union[Image, Text]

Parameters

self¶ – ChooseParameterRow to retrieve quantity from

Return type

Quantity

Get label for parameter value and unit.

Parameters

self¶ – ChooseParameterRow to retrieve label from

Return type

Text

class Layout.ChooseParametersWindow.ChooseParametersWindow(name, runner, quantities, filename='')[source]

Bases: Layout.Layout.Window

This class contains the layout for the choose-parameters window.

  1. Menu: This allows user to (un)check all parameters.

  2. Header to indicate purpose of each column.

  3. Footer with submit and cancel buttons.

  4. Row for each parameter, allowing user to choose whether (or not) to overwrite in model.

Variables

  • quantites – dictionary of parameter quantities. Key is name of parameter. Value is quantity containing value and unit for parameter.

  • filename – name of file that parameters were loaded from (optional)

getFilename()[source]

Get name of file to load parameters from.

Parameters

self¶ – ChooseParametersWindow to retrieve name from

Return type

str

class Layout.ChooseParametersWindow.ChooseParametersWindowRunner(name, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Layout.Layout.WindowRunner

This class runs ChooseParametersWindow. This window allows the user to…

  1. Choose which parameter(s) to overwrite into model.

setChecks(names, overwrite)[source]

Set all checkboxes (determining whether to overwrite parameter) to chosen value.

Parameters

  • self¶ – ChooseParametersWindow to set checkboxes in

  • names¶ – name(s) of parameter(s) to set checkboxes for

  • overwrite¶ – set True to set all checkboxes to True. Set False to set all checkboxes to False.

Return type

None

class Layout.MainWindow.MainWindow(name, runner, blueprint)[source]

Bases: Layout.Layout.TabbedWindow

Primary window to run program.

This contains

  1. TimeEvolutionTabGroup to allow user to set time-evolution properties for each variable

  2. ParameterTabGroup to allow user to set properties for each parameter

class Layout.MainWindow.MainWindowRunner(name, parameter_filenames, function_filenames, time_evolution_layout, parameter_layout, function_layout)[source]

Bases: Layout.Layout.WindowRunner

Runner for MainWindow.

Variables

  • function_ymls – filename(s) of YML files, containing information about functions for model

  • parameters – dictionary of parameter quantities. Key is name of parameter. Value is quantity containing value and unit for parameter.

changeTimeEvolution(name)[source]

Disable input field for initial conditions if time-evolution type is set to “Equilibrium” or if initial condition is set to equilibrium. Disable checkbox if time-evolution type is set to “Equilibrium”. Enable elements otherwise.

Parameters

  • self¶ – ~Layout.MainWindow.MainWindowRunner to retrieve elements from

  • name¶ – name of variable associated with elements

Return type

None

getParameters(names=None, form='quantity')[source]

Get parameter(s), including value and unit

__Recursion Base__

return quantity, value, or unit of single parameter: names [str]

Parameters

  • self¶ – MainWindowRunner to retrieve parameter(s) from

  • names¶ – name(s) of parameter(s) to retreive. Defaults to all parameters.

  • form¶ – form of quantity to retrieve. Each desired option must be a substring of this argument. “quantity”: retrieve value and unit “unit”: retrieve only unit “value”: retrieve only value “base” prefix or suffix: convert to base units (SI)

Return type

Union[Quantity, Dict[str, Quantity], None]

Returns

Quantity for single parameter if names is str List of quantities if names is list. None if parameter is not included in window.

getPlotChoices(model=None)[source]

Get names of variable/functions to analyze for plot.

Parameters

  • self¶ – MainWindowRunner to retrieve choices from

  • model¶ – model to retrieve choices from. Default to model associated with window.

Return type

Dict[str, List[str]]

Returns

Dictionary of plot choices. Key is species of plot choice (e.g. “Variable”, “Function”, “Parameter”). Value is list of names for plot choices.

Set elements with same function to certain value. For example, set all elements that allow user input for time-evolution type to ‘Temporal’.

  • prefix¶ – prefix that elements to change value have in common

  • value¶ – value to set elements to

class Layout.MainWindow.ParameterRow(name, section, parameter_types=('Constant', 'Free'))[source]

Bases: Layout.Layout.TabRow

Row to set properties for parameter.

This contains

  1. Label of parameter name

  2. Label for present parameter value and unit

  3. Input field to set parameter value

  4. Combobox to choose parameter type

class Layout.MainWindow.ParameterSection(name, tab, parameter_names)[source]

Bases: Layout.Layout.Element

Section to organize parameter rows for parameters.

This contains

  1. Header to indicate name of parameter section

  2. collapsable section of ParameterRow for each parameter in section

Variables

  • name – name of section

  • tab – tab that section is stored in

  • parameters_rows – list of ParameterRow, one for each parameter in section

class Layout.MainWindow.TimeEvolutionTab(name, window, variable_names)[source]

Bases: Layout.Layout.Tab

Tab to organize time-evolution rows for variables.

This contains

  1. Header of labels to indicate purpose of each element in variable row

  2. TimeEvolutionVariableRow for each variable in tab

Variables

  • time_evolution_types – dictionary of time-evolution types for variables. Key is name of variable. Value is list of time-evolution types for variable.

  • initial_conditions – dictionary of initial values for variables. Key is name of variable. Value is initial value for variable.

  • variable_rows – list of TimeEvolutionRow, one for each variable in tab

addVariableRows(names)[source]

Add rows corresponding to variable names.

Parameters

  • self¶ – TimeEvolutionTab to add rows to

  • names¶ – name(s) of variable(s) to add rows for

Return type

Union[TimeEvolutionVariableRow, List[TimeEvolutionVariableRow]]

Returns

New row added if names is str. List of new rows if names is list.

getFreeParameterValues(names=None)[source]

Get information about free parameter values for simulation. Uses present state of window. Spawns popup error message if values are (1) of incorrect type or (2) missing.

Parameters

  • self¶ – SetFreeParametersWindowRunner to retrieve values from

  • names¶ – names of parameters to retrieve information for

Return type

Union[List[float], Dict[str, List[float]]]

Returns

Dictionary of information for free parameters if names is list. Key is name of parameter. Value is list of (minimum, maximum, stepcount) for parameter. Returns only this list if names is str.

Layout.SimulationWindow module¶

ParameterSlider(name, window, values)

Slider to choose value for free parameter. This contains #. Four labels. One for parameter name. One for minimum parameter value. One for maximum parameter value. One for number of distinct parameter values #. Slider. This allows the user to choose which parameter value to plot a simulation for.

This class contains the layout for the simulation tab in the simulation window.

This class contains the layout for the aesthetics tab in the simulation window.

This class contains the layout for the plotting tab in the simulation window.

This class contains the layout for the analysis tabgroup in the simulation window.

This class contains the layout for the frequency tab in the analysis tabgroup.

This class contains the layout for the mean tab in the analysis tabgroup.

SimulationWindow(name, runner, …)

This class contains the layout for the simulation window.

SimulationWindowRunner(name, model, **kwargs)

This class runs the simulation and displays results. This window allows the user to… #. Choose which variable/function to plot on each x-axis and y-axis #. Choose which value of free parameters to assume for present plot.

This file contains classes relating to the simulation window. Free parameters are parameters for which multiple values are simulated. The simulation must be run once by hitting the button before the window functions.

class Layout.SimulationWindow.AestheticsTab(name, window)[source]

Bases: Layout.Layout.Tab

This class contains the layout for the aesthetics tab in the simulation window.

  1. Header row to identify functions for input

  2. Axis name label for each axis to identify which axis input affects

  3. Input fields to set lower and upper limit for each axis. Two fields per axis

  4. Checkbox to input whether each axis is autoscaled or manually determined

  5. Combobox to input each axis scale type (e.g. linear, logarithmic)

  6. Update button to allow user to update plot with new aesthetics

class Layout.SimulationWindow.ParameterSlider(name, window, values)[source]

Bases: Layout.Layout.Element

Slider to choose value for free parameter. This contains

  1. Four labels. One for parameter name. One for minimum parameter value. One for maximum parameter value. One for number of distinct parameter values

  2. Slider. This allows the user to choose which parameter value to plot a simulation for.

Variables

  • name – name of parameter

  • minimum – minimum value of parameter

  • maximum – maximum value of parameter

  • stepcount – number of disticnt parameter values

  • units – units of parameter

class Layout.SimulationWindow.SimulationTab(name, window)[source]

Bases: Layout.Layout.Tab

This class contains the layout for the simulation tab in the simulation window.

  1. Input fields to set time steps. This allows the user to set the minimum, maximum, and number of steps for time in the simulation.

  2. Run button. This allows the user to run the simulation. This is particularly useful if the user wishes to run the simulation again with more precision.

class Layout.SimulationWindow.SimulationWindow(name, runner, free_parameter_values, plot_choices)[source]

Bases: Layout.Layout.TabbedWindow

This class contains the layout for the simulation window.

  1. Simulation tab. This tab allows the user to run the simulation and display desired results.

  2. Aesthetics tab. This tab allows the user to set plot aesthetic for the displayed figure.

  3. Analysis tabgroup. This tabgroup allows the user to determine how to execute analysis for plot.

Variables

  • plot_choices – name(s) of variable(s) and/or function(s) that the user may choose to plot

  • free_parameters – name(s) of parameter(s) that the user may choose multiple values for in model

class Layout.SimulationWindow.SimulationWindowRunner(name, model, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Layout.Layout.WindowRunner

This class runs the simulation and displays results. This window allows the user to…

  1. Choose which variable/function to plot on each x-axis and y-axis

  2. Choose which value of free parameters to assume for present plot

Variables

  • values – present values for all elements in window Second index is name of variable/function that the result is stored for.

  • figure_canvas – object storing (1) canvas on which figure is plotted and (2) figure containing plot data

  • model – Model to simulate

  • results – object to store results from most recent simulation. This attribute greatly speeds up grabbing previously-calculated results.

  • general_derivative_vector – partially-simplified, symbolic derivative vector. Simplified as much as possible, except leave free parameters and variables as symbolic.

  • self¶ – SimulationWindowRunner to search for key in

  • key¶ – key of combobox

Returns

Name of axis associated with combobox if key is found. Returns None if key is not found.

getClosestSliderIndex(names=None)[source]

Get location/index of slider closest to value of free parameter. Location is discretized from zero to the number of free-parameter values. Uses present state of SimulationWindowRunner.

  • names¶ – name(s) of parameter(s) associated with slider. Defaults to names of all free parameters.

Return type

Union[int, Tuple[int]]

Slider index for free parameter if names is str. Tuple of slider indicies for all given free parameters if names is list or tuple.

runSimulation(index, parameter_values=None, variable_names=None, general_derivative_vector=None, y0=None, times=None, model=None)[source]

Run simulation for a single set of free-parameter values. Save results in SimulationWindowRunner.

Parameters

  • self¶ – SimulationWindowRunner to retrieve model from and save results in.

  • index¶ – index for free-parameter values. Results are saved at this index.

  • parameter_values¶ – dictionary of free-parameter values. Key is name of each parameter. Value is value of corresponding parameter.

  • variable_names¶ – names of temporal variables in model. This gives the order for arguments in the lambdified derivative vector.

  • general_derivative_vector¶ – partially-simplified, symbolic derivative vector. Simplified as much as possible, except leave free parameters and variables as symbolic.

  • y0¶ – initial condition vector for derivative vector.

  • times¶ – vector of time steps to solve ODE at.

  • model¶ – Model to run simulation for.

Return type

None

runSimulations()[source]

Run simulations for all possible combinations of free-parameter values. Save results in SimulationWindowRunner.

Parameters

self¶ – SimulationWindowRunner to retrieve model from and save results in.

Return type

None

runWindow()[source]

Run simulation window. This function links each possible event to an action. When an event is triggered, its corresponding action is executed.

Parameters

self¶ – SimulationWindowRunner to run

Return type

None

  • name¶ – name of parameter to loop over for GIF

Return type

Parameters

  • self¶ – SimulationWindowRunner to save Results in

  • kwargs¶ – additional arguments to pass into setResults()

Return type

None

updateFigureCanvas(figure)[source]

Update figure-canvas aggregate in simulation window. This plots the most up-to-date data and aesthetics on the plot.

Parameters

  • self¶ – SimulationWindowRunner to update figure-canvas in

  • figure¶ – new figure (containing most up-to-date information) to plot

Return type

Optional[FigureCanvasTkAgg]

Returns

New figure-canvas stored in window runner.

updatePlot(index=None, plot_quantities=None, transform_name=None, **figure_kwargs)[source]

Update window-embedded plot. Do nothing if simulation has never been run.

Parameters

  • index¶ – index of parameter value for free parameter(s)

  • plot_quantities¶ – dictionary storing information for plot quantities. Key is name of axis to plot quantity on. Value is tuple of quantity information. First element gives quantity name. Second element gives quantity type. Third element gives condensor name.

  • transform_name¶ – type of transform to perform on quantities before plotting

  • figure_kwargs¶ – additional arguments to pass into getFigure()

Return type

Optional[Figure]

Returns

New matplotlib Figure displayed on canvas. None if figure has not been displayed yet.

updatePlotChoices(names=None, choices=None)[source]

Update plot choices for desired axis(es). This allows user to select new set of quantities to plot.

Parameters

  • self¶ – ~Layout.SimulationWindow.SimulationWindowRunner to change plot choices in

  • names¶ – name(s) of axis(es) to update choices for. Updates all axes by default.

  • choices¶ – names of updated choices for axis. Only called if names if str.

Return type

None

static updateProgessMeter(current_value, max_value)[source]

Update progress meter. This meter keeps track of how many simulations have finished.

Parameters

  • current_value¶ – present number of simulation being calculated

  • max_value¶ – total number of simulations to calculate

Return type

one_line_progress_meter

  • maximum¶ – maximum value

  • step_count¶ – number of values from minimum to maximum, inclusive

Layout.SimulationWindow.drawFigure(canvas, figure)[source]

Draw figure on canvas.

Parameters

  • canvas¶ – canvas to draw figure on

  • figure¶ – figure containing data to draw on canvas

Return type

FigureCanvasTkAgg

Layout.SimulationWindow.getFigure(x, y, c=None, x_scale_factor=1, y_scale_factor=1, c_scale_factor=1, plot_type='xy', segment_length=None, clim=(None, None), autoscalec_on=True, colorbar_kwargs=None, axes_kwargs=None, inset_parameters=None)[source]

Get matplotlib figure from data.

Parameters

  • x¶ – data to plot on x-axis

  • y¶ – data to plot on y-axis

  • c¶ – data to plot on c-axis (colorbar)

  • x_scale_factor¶ – factor to divide x by before plotting

  • y_scale_factor¶ – factor to divide y by before plotting

  • c_scale_factor¶ – factor to divide c by before plotting

  • clim¶ – axis bounds for colorbar. First element gives lower limit. Defaults to minium of c. Second element gives upper limit. Defaults to maximum of c.

  • autoscalec_on¶ – set True to autoscale colorbar axis. Set False otherwise. Overrides clim when set True.

  • plot_type¶ – type of plot to display. This could include a single curve, multiple curves, scatter plot.

  • segment_length¶ – length of line segment in points for multicolored line. Defaults to length such that ~100 segments are drawn. Only called when colorbar dimension is given and line is multicolored.

  • inset_parameters¶ –

    2-level dictionary of parameters to show on inset plot. Key is name of parameter. Subkeys are “range” and “value”

    ”range”: value is tuple (minimum, maximum) for parameter “value”: value is value for parameter within range

  • colorbar_kwargs¶ – additional arguments to pass into matplotlib.pyplot.colorbar

  • axes_kwargs¶ – additional arguments to pass into :class:`matplotlib.axes.Axes’

Return type

Figure

Layout.SimulationWindow.getParameterInsetAxes(axes, parameter_values, color='black', marker='o', markersize=2, linestyle='', clip_on=False, labelpad=2, fontsize=8)[source]

Get inset axes object and partially-completed plot for inset axes. This inset plot displays values for up to two free parameters during a parameter sweep.

Parameters

  • axes¶ – axes to nest inset plot inside into

  • parameter_values¶ – dictionary of parameter values. Key is name of parameter. Value is 2-tuple of (minimum, maximum) values for parameter.

  • color¶ – marker color for inset plot

  • marker¶ – marker type for inset plot

  • markersize¶ – marker size inset plot

  • linestyle¶ – linestyle for inset plot

  • clip_on¶ – set True to allow points to extend outside inset plot. Set False otherwise.

  • labelpad¶ – padding for axis label(s)

  • fontsize¶ – fontsize for axis label(s)

Return type

Tuple[Axes, partial]

Returns

Tuple of (inset axes object, plot function taking single point of free parameters as input).

  • new_units¶ – units or quantity with units to convert to

Layout.__init__ module¶

This package contains a collection of files related to the GUI and its layout.
